chef_bio: Ayesha Siddika is a renowned chef from Dhaka with over 10 years of experience in Bangladeshi cuisine.

recipes.cooking_method: Mix the rice flour, coconut, jaggery and salt in a bowl. Add water and mix to form a thick batter. Heat a pan and pour a ladle of the batter. Cover and cook until it is cooked through. Serve hot with tea.

Wash the rice and lentils and soak for 30 minutes. In a pan, heat the ghee and fry the onions, garlic and ginger. Add the chili powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander and salt. Add the rice and lentils and saute for a few minutes. Add water and cook until done.

Marinate the mutton in yogurt, garlic and ginger paste for an hour. In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add the marinated mutton and fry until the water evaporates. Add water and cook until the meat is tender. Add cream and the spices and cook for a few minutes.

chef_bio: Sadia Ahmed is a passionate chef from Chittagong who loves to experiment with different spices and flavors.

recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the hilsa fish with salt and turmeric. In a pan, heat oil and fry the fish until golden brown. In the same oil, add mustard paste, chili powder, cumin, coriander and salt. Add water and cook for a few minutes. Add the fried fish and cook for a few more minutes.

Marinate the beef with salt, chili powder, turmeric, cumin and coriander. In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add the marinated beef and fry until the water evaporates. Add water and cook until the beef is tender. Add rice and cook until done.

Soak the chickpeas overnight and cook until soft. Boil the potatoes and chop into small pieces. In a bowl, mix the chickpeas, potatoes, onion, green chili, coriander, tamarind pulp and salt. Serve with crispy shells made of flour.

chef_bio: Tahmina Rahman is a creative chef from Sylhet who loves to mix traditional and modern cooking techniques.

recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the beef with salt, cumin, coriander and turmeric. In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger and green chili. Add the marinated beef and fry until the water evaporates. Add water and cook until the beef is tender. Add shatkora and cook for a few more minutes.
In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger and green chili. Add the shrimp and fry for a few minutes. Add coconut milk and the spices. Cook for a few more minutes.

Peel and chop the bottle gourd. In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger and green chili. Add the bottle gourd and fry for a few minutes. Add spinach and the spices. Cook for a few more minutes.

chef_bio: Rahman Khan is a well-known chef in Dhaka who has worked in many famous restaurants.

recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the beef with salt, cumin, coriander and turmeric. In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger and green chili. Add the marinated beef and fry until the water evaporates. Add water and cook until the beef is tender. Garnish with coriander.

Grind chitol fish, potato, onion, garlic, ginger and green chili into a smooth paste. Add cumin, coriander, turmeric and salt. Mix well and form small balls. In a pan, heat oil and fry the balls until golden brown. Serve with mustard sauce.

Boil milk in a pot. Add lemon juice and stir until the milk curdles. Strain the curdled milk and wash with water to remove the lemon flavor. Squeeze the water out of the curdled milk and knead it into a dough. Form small balls from the dough. In a pot, mix sugar and water and bring to a boil. Add cardamom and rose water. Add the balls and cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let it sit in a warm place for 6-7 hours to set. Refrigerate and serve chilled.

chef_bio: Anjuman Ara is a home cook who specializes in traditional Bengali cuisine.

recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric. In a pan, heat oil and fry the fish until golden brown. In the same pan, fry green chili until golden brown. Add mustard paste and water. Cook until the oil separates. Add the fish and cook for a few more minutes.

Mix rice flour and water to form a dough. In a separate pan, melt jaggery and add coconut and cardamom. Mix well. Form small balls from the dough and flatten them. Stuff with the jaggery mixture and seal the edges. Steam for 10-15 minutes.
Cut eggplant into thin slices. Marinate with turmeric and salt. In a pan, heat oil and fry the eggplant slices until golden brown.

chef_bio: Mehdi Hasan is a professional chef who has worked in various high-end restaurants.

recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, heat oil and fry sliced onions until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and green chili. Fry until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft. Add beef and cook until tender. Add garam masala and coriander. Cook for a few more minutes.

In a pan, heat oil and fry sliced onions until golden brown. Add garlic, ginger, and green chili. Fry until fragrant. Add turmeric, chili powder, cumin, coriander, and salt. Cook until fragrant. Add coconut milk and prawns. Cook until the prawns are done. Add garam masala and coriander. Cook for a few more minutes.

Boil milk ina pot until it reduces to half. Add sugar and cardamom. Mix well and let it cool down. In a separate bowl, mix yogurt and rose water. Add the cooled milk mixture and mix well. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and cover it with aluminum foil. Place the baking dish into a steamer and steam for 20-25 minutes. Once done, let it cool down and refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

Grind mustard seeds, turmeric, green chili, and salt into a fine paste. Marinate the Hilsa fish with the paste. In a pan, heat mustard oil and fry the fish on both sides until golden brown. Serve hot with rice.
